result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Lonny J.F. Rew was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: and retroactive to administrative suspension

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and service fees- to be repaid during probation

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent. 
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Def must attend the Victim Impact Panel--def already completed while in jail.
Def must submit DNA sample on 10-5-16
Def must continue to pay atty fees to the Clerk's office $100/month until paid in full
Weekly drug testing-observed and random testing
Assessments, counseling, and follow through as determined by agent
Continue to attend AA or similar program as determined by agent

timeConds.notes: To be served in an alcohol prevention type of activity as determined by agent. 20 hours of community service per year of probation.

3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision
3 years probation:
230 days jail. 230 days credit. Time served.

Ignition Interlock
24 mo DL rev- retro and concurrent
Pay costs & SF- to be repaid during probation

Def must give DNA sample today
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Weekly drug testing- observed and random testing
60 hours of community service in a alcohol prevention type of activity as determined by agent- 20 hours per year of probation
